DESCRIPTION OF # ^ — "CONVERSATION ABROAD" — YOUNG YUGOSLAVIAN STUDENT HOST
TO MERICAN S INDENT, GROUP IN 1955
Describes total program and activities of the 1955 group of Americans in
Yugoslavia also, as an economics student goes into detail on his country's
"postwar political and economic revolution" when Tito became national
president; describes destruction of the country during the war, and the need
to not only rebuild an economic and political structure, but to rebuild human
families (of million and half Slovenians —one-half million died in World
War n). Stresses that Yugoslavia's "economic” system is a Socialist form
of government built from a melting pot of ideas from England, France as well
as Russian Communism and applied to the needs and resources of his country,,
Acknowledges American, French, and English help along with that of Russia in
rebuilding their country along more modern lines in agriculture and mining,
particularly. Describes the visit of the Americans in 1955, and reports on
continued correspondence over the past year and sincere friendship which
developed not only among the students and their hosts families, but among the
townspeople as well.
